# Reflected XSS at /lgsl_files/lgsl_list.php


**Description:**

Vulnerability: A reflected XSS vulnerability exists in the `Referer` HTTP header of [LGSL v6.2.1](https://github.com/tltneon/lgsl/releases/tag/v6.2.1). The vulnerability allows attackers to inject arbitrary JavaScript code, which is reflected in the HTML response without proper sanitization.
When crafted malicious input is provided in the `Referer` header, it is echoed back into an HTML attribute in the applicationâ€™s response.


The vulnerability is present at [Line 20-24](https://github.com/tltneon/lgsl/blob/master/lgsl_files/lgsl_list.php#L20-L24)
```php
  $uri = $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'];

  if ($lgsl_config['preloader']) {
    $uri = $_SERVER['HTTP_REFERER'];
  }
```

**Proof of Concept:**
1. Capture a request to the path `/lgsl_files/lgsl_list.php`.
2. Inject the following payload into the Referer header: `test'><script>alert(1)</script><`.
3. Send the request.
4. The XSS payload is triggered when reloading.
